title: Apple Pay Later turns Apple into a full-on money lender
description: Financial product launches nearly a year after it was first announced.

title: Healthy adults don’t need annual COVID boosters, WHO advisors say
description: The advice clashes with FDA's suggestion to treat COVID boosters like flu shots.

title: Huawei’s foldable is thinner, lighter, and has more battery than Samsung
description: Huawei can't use 5G, Gorilla Glass, or the Google apps, but it's managing.

title: SBF paid $40M bribe to unfreeze crypto trading accounts in China, US charges
description: SBF bribe violated US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, updated indictment says.

title: Report: Twitter secretly boosted accounts instead of treating everyone equally
description: Shadowy list of favored users include Joe Biden, LeBron James, and @dril.

title: Open source espresso machine is one delicious rabbit hole inside another
description: The path to epic coffee winds past Arduinos, breadboards, and firmware flashing.

title: US agency sues top crypto exchange Binance and CEO, seeks permanent trading bans
description: CFTC: Binance and execs operate an "illegal digital asset derivatives exchange."

title: Human cells hacked to act like squid skin cells could unlock key to camouflage
description: It's not possible to culture squid skin cells in the lab; this approach provides a solution.

title: How a beloved classic Porsche became a Transformer
description: The star of Transformers: Rise of the Beasts takes inspiration from an action movie classic.

title: Fast radio burst may point to the first “blitzar” we’ve observed
description: Radio burst may come from a neutron star that's too big to live.

title: Tears of the Kingdom lets you make weapons, rafts, and more from component parts
description: Other vertically focused abilities help Link reach far-off "sky islands."

title: A front-runner emerges in the European small launcher race
description: Isar Aerospace could launch its Spectrum rocket within the next year.

title: Generative AI set to affect 300 million jobs across major economies
description: Technology could boost global GDP by 7% but also risks creating "significant disruption."
